title: Liverpool injury news: Mohamed Salah set to return for Spurs clash
text:
Mohamed Salah is set to return either against Genk or Tottenham (Picture: Getty)

Liverpool expect Mohamed Salah to be fit for Sunday’s clash against Tottenham after the Egyptian returned to full training on Tuesday.

The forward missed Sunday’s 1-1 draw at Old Trafford after failing to recover from a knock he took against Leicester City in injury time of the Reds’ 2-1 win against the Foxes before the international break.

Divock Origi started in Salah’s place against United and Liverpool missed his attacking prowess with Jurgen Klopp thankful that Adam Lallana bailed his side out after a below-par performance.

Liverpool face Genk in the Champions League on Wednesday and Salah trained with the rest of the group today as the Reds look to defend their European crown this week.

Klopp is unlikely to risk Salah against the Belgians but it’s positive news for the Reds, who face out of form Tottenham at Anfield on Sunday.

Advertisement

Advertisement

While Salah returned, there was no sign of Joel Matip or Trent Alexander-Arnold at Melwood.

It could mean Dejan Lovren comes into the side against Genk.

description: Liverpool expect Mohamed Salah to be fit for Sunday's clash against Tottenham after the Egyptian returned to full training on Tuesday. The forward missed Sunday's 1-1 draw at Old Trafford...
